results.title: Oh! What a night
results.creator_credit: W H Productions, Keystone Film Company and Mack Sennett
results.brief_description: Charlie and Fatty, both well-dressed but very drunk, come home to their long-suffering wives in facing apartments in the same hotel. The women remonstrate so the men go off out again together to a restaurant where they create total chaos and mayhem and are finally ejected from the premises. They then stumble across a row boat in the park and climb in to try and get some sleep - as the film ends we see a sinking boat full of water! Cast: Charlie Chaplin, Fatty Arbuckle, Phyllis Allen and Minta Durfee

results.title: Oh sure
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Michael Scott, Jerry Krepakevich and Richard Condie
results.brief_description: The subject of this film is unmistakable: how to make a fool of oneself easily and effectively. Two men are involved: one who wishes to read his newspaper and another who insists on performing acrobatic feats. Although the outcome is surprising, the message is clear; the film points out the futility of going to great lengths to impress one’s neighbor.

results.title: Oh No! It's the Franciscus Henri video
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Trish Foremen, Graham Slattery and Rob Pemberton
results.brief_description: Franciscus Henri has entertained children for many years with his wacky and original songs. After all, a man with a zoo in his house, wearing purple polka-dotted pyjamas, an octopus on his head and who can make unusual pancakes is not to be missed! Stroll with Franciscus Henri through the Milky Way and have lots of fun!

results.title: Offstage, onstage: inside the Stratford Festival [Widescreen
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Gerry Flahive and John Smith
results.brief_description: This documentary presents an inside look at one of Canada’s largest and most well-known theatre companies, Stratford, at work during its 2001 Festival season. Founded by Tom Patterson in 1953, this classical repertory theatre company presents more than a dozen plays each season, from Shakespeare to modern classics to new works and provides employment for not just aspiring actors and directors, but designers, technicians, backstage hands and other staff. Through interviews with the Artistic Director, Richard Monette, Stage Manager, Louise Currie, directors Scott Wentworth, Diana Leblanc, Props Master Frank Holte and actors Rami Posner, Douglas Campbell, William Hutt, Martha Henry, Lucy Peacock and others, the viewer is witness to the inner sanctum of live theatre performance and the important role each has to play to bring the written word to life. Provides a fascinating look at props, set design, costume design, stage design, make-up, actors in preparation, rehearsals, and excerpts from some of the performances including “Who’s Afraid of Virginia Woolf?”, “Merchant of Venice” and “Inherit the Wind”. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Offshore oil: are we ready?
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rex Tasker and Paul MacLeod
results.brief_description: A cautionary document that explores in depth the impact that offshore oil discoveries have had on Stavanger, Norway, and on Aberdeen and the Shetland Islands in Scotland. Confronted by the huge deposits in the Hibernia field off Newfoundland, Atlantic Canadians are advised to begin planning now for the inevitable effects that this oil will have on their indigenous industries, particularly fisheries. In addition to its relevance to Atlantic Canada, the film holds interest for anyone concerned about the effects of heavy, rapid industrialization on both the environment and traditional ways of life.
